name: jQuery.isEmptyObject
title: jQuery.isEmptyObject()
desc: Check to see if an object is empty (contains no enumerable properties).

argument.desc: The object that will be checked to see if it's empty.
argument.name: object

examples.desc: Check an object to see if it's empty.

entries.longdesc: As of jQuery 1.4 this method checks both properties on the object itself and properties inherited from prototypes (in that it doesn't use hasOwnProperty). The argument should always be a plain JavaScript Object as other types of object (DOM elements, primitive strings/numbers, host objects) may not give consistent results across browsers. To determine if an object is a plain JavaScript object, use $.isPlainObject()
